comment.author: 92584555@N07
comment._content: Perth Government School, St George's Terrace. catalogue.slwa.wa.gov.au/record=b2459635~S6#.UQNpE7ZGh10

comment.author: 92581505@N02
comment._content: This building was the old 'Perth Boys School', it now houses a cafe and is located at 139 St Georges Terrace. It was designed by William Sandford in 1852 and completed in 1854, though what you see here is an extended version, with extensions completed in 1868.

comment.author: 33364206@N05
comment._content:
from Perth and Fremantle Past and Present by Simon J Nevill
Built in 1854.  The design was credited to William Sanford but the working drawings were drawn by the Colonial Architect Richard Roach Jewell.  Perth Boy's School served as a school until 1910, then it became an annexe to Perth Technical College.
